<task>
I need you to implement the advanced diagnostic toolkit created by Debug mode and then apply the appropriate solution from the solution plan based on the diagnostic results. The web app still isn't loading on GoDaddy hosting despite our previous fixes.

Context:
- We initially improved Firebase security by moving hardcoded credentials to environment variables
- We implemented fixes for GoDaddy deployment, but the site still doesn't work
- Debug mode has created a diagnostic toolkit and solution plan to identify and fix the specific issues

The diagnostic toolkit includes:
- firebase-advanced-diagnostics.html: Interactive diagnostic page
- firebase-diagnostics.js: JavaScript that performs detailed tests
- firebase-diagnostics-README.md: Instructions for using the tool

The solution plan (firebase-godaddy-solution-plan.md) includes multiple approaches based on diagnostic findings, with the most likely issues being:
1. Content Security Policy (CSP) restrictions
2. GoDaddy hosting limitations affecting Firebase initialization

Your task is to:
1. Implement the diagnostic toolkit files if they don't already exist
2. Modify the solution plan based on your expertise if needed
3. Implement the most appropriate solution from the plan that will definitely work on GoDaddy hosting
4. Test the solution locally to ensure it works before deployment
5. Provide clear instructions for deploying the fixed version to GoDaddy

Please focus on creating a solution that will work reliably on GoDaddy shared hosting, even if it means compromising some of the security improvements. When complete, use the `attempt_completion` tool with a comprehensive summary of what you implemented and how it resolves the deployment issues.

These specific instructions supersede any conflicting general instructions you might have.
</task>

<content lines="1-193">
  1 | # Firebase on GoDaddy: Comprehensive Solution Plan
  2 | 
  3 | ## Diagnostic Summary
  4 | 
  5 | Based on our analysis of the existing code and configuration, we've identified several potential reasons why the web app still isn't loading on GoDaddy hosting despite previous fixes:
  6 | 
  7 | 1. **Content Security Policy (CSP) Restrictions**: The CSP in index.html and .htaccess may be blocking necessary Firebase connections.
  8 | 
  9 | 2. **GoDaddy Hosting Limitations**: GoDaddy might have specific hosting restrictions that block certain Firebase connections.
 10 | 
 11 | 3. **Script Loading Order**: There might be race conditions or timing issues with script loading.
 12 | 
 13 | 4. **Firebase SDK Version Compatibility**: The app uses Firebase SDK 9.6.1, which might have compatibility issues with the configuration approach.
 14 | 
 15 | 5. **Firebase App Check Issues**: The App Check initialization might be failing on GoDaddy.
 16 | 
 17 | 6. **Missing Firebase Configuration Fields**: The configuration might be missing fields required by specific Firebase services.
 18 | 
 19 | 7. **JavaScript Errors in Other Parts**: Errors elsewhere in the application might be preventing proper loading.
 20 | 
 21 | ## Diagnostic Approach
 22 | 
 23 | We've created an advanced diagnostic tool (`firebase-advanced-diagnostics.html` and `firebase-diagnostics.js`) that will help identify the specific issue. This tool:
 24 | 
 25 | 1. Tests connectivity to all required Firebase domains
 26 | 2. Checks if the Content Security Policy is blocking any connections
 27 | 3. Provides detailed logging of the Firebase initialization process
 28 | 4. Captures and displays any JavaScript errors
 29 | 5. Tests different Firebase configuration approaches
 30 | 
 31 | ## Solution Strategies
 32 | 
 33 | Based on what the diagnostic tool finds, here are potential solutions:
 34 | 
 35 | ### 1. If CSP Issues Are Detected
 36 | 
 37 | Update the Content Security Policy in both the HTML meta tag and .htaccess file to include all required Firebase domains:
 38 | 
 39 | ```html
 40 | <!-- Updated CSP in index.html -->
 41 | <meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' https://www.googletagmanager.com https://www.google-analytics.com https://www.gstatic.com 'unsafe-inline'; style-src 'self' https://fonts.googleapis.com 'unsafe-inline'; font-src 'self' https://fonts.gstatic.com; img-src 'self' data: https:; connect-src 'self' https://api.aisportsedge.com https://www.google-analytics.com https://firebaseinstallations.googleapis.com https://firebaseremoteconfig.googleapis.com https://firestore.googleapis.com https://firebase.googleapis.com https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com https://www.googleapis.com; frame-src 'self' https://accounts.google.com https://aisportsedge.firebaseapp.com; object-src 'none';">
 42 | ```
 43 | 
 44 | ```apache
 45 | # Updated CSP in .htaccess
 46 | <IfModule mod_headers.c>
 47 |   Header set Content-Security-Policy "default-src * data: blob: 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'; script-src * data: blob: 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'; style-src * 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src * data: blob:; font-src * data:; connect-src * https://firebaseinstallations.googleapis.com https://firebaseremoteconfig.googleapis.com https://firestore.googleapis.com https://firebase.googleapis.com https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com https://www.googleapis.com; frame-src *;"
 48 | </IfModule>
 49 | ```
 50 | 
 51 | ### 2. If GoDaddy Hosting Limitations Are Detected
 52 | 
 53 | #### Option A: Simplified Firebase Configuration
 54 | 
 55 | Create a more minimal Firebase configuration that only includes essential services:
 56 | 
 57 | ```javascript
 58 | // Simplified firebase-config.js
 59 | window.FIREBASE_CONFIG = {
 60 |   apiKey: "AIzaSyDxLufbPyNYpax2MmE5ff27MHA-js9INBw",
 61 |   authDomain: "ai-sports-edge.firebaseapp.com",
 62 |   projectId: "ai-sports-edge"
 63 |   // Remove other properties that might be causing issues
 64 | };
 65 | ```
 66 | 
 67 | #### Option B: Firebase REST API Fallback
 68 | 
 69 | For critical functionality, implement a server-side proxy or use the Firebase REST API directly instead of the client SDK:
 70 | 
 71 | ```javascript
 72 | // Example of using Firebase REST API for authentication
 73 | function signInWithEmailPassword(email, password) {
 74 |   const apiKey = "AIzaSyDxLufbPyNYpax2MmE5ff27MHA-js9INBw";
 75 |   
 76 |   return fetch(`https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com/v1/accounts:signInWithPassword?key=${apiKey}`, {
 77 |     method: 'POST',
 78 |     headers: {
 79 |       'Content-Type': 'application/json'
 80 |     },
 81 |     body: JSON.stringify({
 82 |       email,
 83 |       password,
 84 |       returnSecureToken: true
 85 |     })
 86 |   })
 87 |   .then(response => response.json())
 88 |   .then(data => {
 89 |     // Handle the authentication response

 93 |     } else {

 97 |   });
 98 | }

134 |       // Load Firebase Auth after App is loaded
135 |       const firebaseAuthScript = document.createElement('script');
136 |       firebaseAuthScript.src = 'https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.6.1/firebase-auth-compat.js';
137 |       firebaseAuthScript.onload = () => {
138 |         console.log('Firebase Auth SDK loaded');
139 |         // Initialize Firebase here or trigger an event that other scripts can listen for
140 |         const event = new Event('firebase-sdk-loaded');
141 |         document.dispatchEvent(event);
142 |       };
143 |       document.head.appendChild(firebaseAuthScript);
144 |     };
145 |     document.head.appendChild(firebaseAppScript);
146 |   });
147 | </script>
148 | ```
149 | 
150 | ### 4. If Firebase SDK Version Issues Are Detected
151 | 
152 | Try using a different version of the Firebase SDK:
153 | 
154 | ```html
155 | <!-- Try an older version of Firebase -->
156 | <script src="https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/8.10.0/firebase-app.js"></script>
157 | <script src="https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/8.10.0/firebase-auth.js"></script>
158 | 
159 | <!-- Or try the latest version -->
160 | <script src="https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.19.1/firebase-app-compat.js"></script>
161 | <script src="https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/9.19.1/firebase-auth-compat.js"></script>
162 | ```
163 | 
164 | ### 5. Radical Approach: Static Site with API Calls
165 | 
166 | If all else fails, consider converting critical Firebase functionality to use REST APIs and implement a more static approach:
167 | 
168 | 1. Pre-generate as much content as possible during build time
169 | 2. Use Firebase REST APIs for dynamic content
170 | 3. Implement a lightweight client-side state management without Firebase SDK
171 | 4. Consider adding a small server-side component (Node.js, PHP) as a proxy to Firebase services
172 | 
173 | ## Implementation Plan
174 | 
175 | 1. **Deploy Diagnostic Tool**: Upload the diagnostic files to your GoDaddy hosting and run the tests
176 | 2. **Analyze Results**: Identify the specific issues based on test results
177 | 3. **Implement Targeted Fixes**: Apply the appropriate solutions from the strategies above
178 | 4. **Test Incrementally**: Make one change at a time and test after each change
179 | 5. **Verify Solution**: Ensure the web app loads correctly and all functionality works
180 | 
181 | ## Security Considerations
182 | 
183 | While implementing these fixes, keep in mind:
184 | 
185 | 1. **API Key Protection**: Even though the API key is already exposed in client-side code, consider implementing Firebase Security Rules to restrict access based on authentication and authorization.
186 | 
187 | 2. **CSP Balance**: When relaxing the Content Security Policy, try to be as specific as possible with the domains you allow rather than using wildcards.
188 | 
189 | 3. **Error Handling**: Implement robust error handling to gracefully handle any Firebase initialization failures.
190 | 
191 | 4. **User Experience**: Consider adding a loading state that provides feedback to users if there are delays in Firebase initialization.
192 | 
193 | By following this comprehensive plan, you should be able to identify and resolve the issues preventing your web app from loading on GoDaddy hosting.
</content>

<content lines="1-79">
 1 | # Firebase Advanced Diagnostics Tool
 2 | 
 3 | This diagnostic tool is designed to help identify issues with Firebase initialization on GoDaddy hosting. It provides comprehensive testing and analysis to pinpoint why your web app isn't loading properly despite previous fixes.
 4 | 
 5 | ## How to Use
 6 | 
 7 | 1. **Upload the Files**: Upload both `firebase-advanced-diagnostics.html` and `firebase-diagnostics.js` to your GoDaddy hosting server in the same directory as your main application.
 8 | 
 9 | 2. **Access the Tool**: Navigate to the diagnostic page in your browser:
10 |    ```
11 |    https://yourdomain.com/firebase-advanced-diagnostics.html
12 |    ```
13 | 
14 | 3. **Run the Tests**: The tool will automatically run several initial tests. You'll need to manually click the buttons to run the connectivity tests and Firebase initialization tests.
15 | 
16 | 4. **Review the Results**: The tool will display detailed results for each test, along with recommendations based on the findings.
17 | 
18 | 5. **Share the Results**: Take screenshots or copy the text from each section to share with developers or support personnel.
19 | 
20 | ## What This Tool Tests
21 | 
22 | ### 1. Browser and Environment Information
23 | Displays information about your browser and environment, which can help identify browser-specific issues.
24 | 
25 | ### 2. Firebase Configuration Check
26 | Verifies that the Firebase configuration is properly loaded and contains all required properties.
27 | 
28 | ### 3. Network Connectivity Tests
29 | Tests connectivity to all Firebase domains required for proper operation. This helps identify if GoDaddy is blocking any required connections.
30 | 
31 | ### 4. Content Security Policy (CSP) Analysis
32 | Analyzes the Content Security Policy to check if it might be blocking Firebase connections. This is a common issue with web applications.
33 | 
34 | ### 5. Firebase Initialization Test
35 | Tests Firebase initialization with different configuration approaches:
36 | - **Global Config**: Uses the window.FIREBASE_CONFIG object
37 | - **Inline Config**: Uses a hardcoded configuration
38 | - **Fallback Config**: Uses a minimal configuration with only essential fields
39 | 
40 | ### 6. Error Monitoring
41 | Captures and displays any JavaScript errors that occur during the tests, which can help identify runtime issues.
42 | 
43 | ### 7. Recommendations
44 | Provides specific recommendations based on the test results to help resolve the issues.
45 | 
46 | ## Interpreting the Results
47 | 
48 | ### If Connectivity Tests Fail
49 | This suggests that GoDaddy might be blocking connections to Firebase domains. You may need to:
50 | - Contact GoDaddy support to ask about firewall rules or connection restrictions
51 | - Consider using a different hosting provider that doesn't restrict these connections
52 | 
53 | ### If CSP Analysis Shows Issues
54 | Your Content Security Policy might be too restrictive. You'll need to update the CSP in both:
55 | - The meta tag in your HTML file
56 | - The .htaccess file
57 | 
58 | ### If Firebase Initialization Tests Fail
59 | This could indicate issues with your Firebase configuration. Pay attention to:
60 | - Which approach works (global, inline, or fallback)
61 | - Any specific error messages displayed
62 | - Whether Firebase Auth initialization succeeds or fails
63 | 
64 | ## Next Steps
65 | 
66 | After identifying the specific issue, you can implement the recommended fixes:
67 | 
68 | 1. **For CSP Issues**: Update the Content Security Policy in both your HTML and .htaccess files.
69 | 
70 | 2. **For Configuration Issues**: Modify your Firebase configuration approach based on which test was successful.
71 | 
72 | 3. **For GoDaddy Limitations**: Consider implementing a more radical approach, such as:
73 |    - Using a completely hardcoded Firebase configuration
74 |    - Simplifying your Firebase usage to only essential services
75 |    - Moving to a different hosting provider
76 | 
77 | ## Security Note
78 | 
79 | This diagnostic tool includes hardcoded Firebase configuration values for testing purposes. While these values are already exposed in your client-side code, you should remove this diagnostic tool from your production server once you've resolved the issues.
</content>
</file>

  function waitForFirebaseConfig(callback, maxAttempts = 20) {
    let attempts = 0;
    const checkInterval = setInterval(() => {
      attempts++;
      if (window.FIREBASE_CONFIG) {
        clearInterval(checkInterval);
        console.log('Firebase configuration loaded successfully');
        callback();
      } else if (attempts >= maxAttempts) {
        clearInterval(checkInterval);
        console.error('Firebase configuration failed to load after multiple attempts');
        // Try to use a fallback configuration
        window.FIREBASE_CONFIG = {
          apiKey: "AIzaSyDxLufbPyNYpax2MmE5ff27MHA-js9INBw",
          authDomain: "ai-sports-edge.firebaseapp.com",
          projectId: "ai-sports-edge"
        };
        console.log('Using fallback Firebase configuration');
        callback();
      }
    }, 100);
  }
  
  // Only load Firebase SDK after configuration is available

    // Dynamically load Firebase SDK scripts
    const firebaseAppScript = document.createElement('script');

          // Dispatch an event that other scripts can listen for

            firebase.initializeApp(minimalConfig);

<content>/**
 * Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility Script
 * 
 * This script provides additional compatibility fixes for Firebase on GoDaddy hosting.
 * It addresses common issues with:
 * 1. Content Security Policy (CSP) restrictions
 * 2. Script loading order and race conditions
 * 3. Firebase initialization failures
 * 4. Network connectivity issues
 */

(function() {
  console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Script loaded');
  
  // Check if we're running on GoDaddy hosting
  const isGoDaddy = function() {
    try {
      // Check for common GoDaddy server signatures
      return (
        document.cookie.indexOf('GoDaddy') !== -1 ||
        navigator.userAgent.indexOf('GoDaddy') !== -1 ||
        (typeof window.location !== 'undefined' && 
         window.location.hostname.indexOf('secureserver.net') !== -1)
      );
    } catch (e) {
      console.error('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Error checking for GoDaddy:', e);
      return false;
    }
  };
  
  // Apply CSP fixes if needed
  const applyCSPFixes = function() {
    try {
      // Check if we have a CSP meta tag
      const cspMeta = document.querySelector('meta[http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy"]');
      if (cspMeta) {
        console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Found CSP meta tag');
        
        // Get the current CSP content
        const cspContent = cspMeta.getAttribute('content');
        
        // Check if it's missing any required Firebase domains
        const requiredDomains = [
          'https://firebase.googleapis.com',
          'https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com',
          'https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com',
          'https://www.googleapis.com'
        ];
        
        let needsUpdate = false;
        for (const domain of requiredDomains) {
          if (cspContent.indexOf(domain) === -1) {
            needsUpdate = true;
            break;
          }
        }
        
        if (needsUpdate) {
          console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] CSP needs update, applying fix');
          
          // Create a more permissive CSP that includes all required domains
          // This is done dynamically to avoid modifying the HTML file
          const newCSP = cspContent
            .replace('connect-src', 'connect-src https://firebase.googleapis.com https://identitytoolkit.googleapis.com https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com https://www.googleapis.com');
          
          // Update the CSP meta tag
          cspMeta.setAttribute('content', newCSP);
          console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] CSP updated dynamically');
        }
      }
    } catch (e) {
      console.error('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Error applying CSP fixes:', e);
    }
  };
  
  // Fix Firebase initialization issues
  const fixFirebaseInitialization = function() {
    // Wait for the firebase-initialized event or timeout
    let initializationTimeout = setTimeout(function() {
      console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Firebase initialization timeout, applying fallback');
      
      // Check if Firebase is already initialized
      if (typeof firebase !== 'undefined' && firebase.apps && firebase.apps.length > 0) {
        console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Firebase is already initialized, no action needed');
        return;
      }
      
      // Try to initialize Firebase with the fallback configuration
      try {
        if (typeof firebase !== 'undefined' && typeof window.FIREBASE_CONFIG !== 'undefined') {
          // Use minimal configuration
          const minimalConfig = {
            apiKey: window.FIREBASE_CONFIG.apiKey,
            authDomain: window.FIREBASE_CONFIG.authDomain,
            projectId: window.FIREBASE_CONFIG.projectId
          };
          
          console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Initializing Firebase with minimal config');
          firebase.initializeApp(minimalConfig);
          console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Firebase initialized with minimal config');
          
          // Dispatch the firebase-initialized event
          document.dispatchEvent(new Event('firebase-initialized'));
        }
      } catch (e) {
        console.error('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Error in fallback initialization:', e);
      }
    }, 5000);
    
    // Clear the timeout if Firebase is initialized properly
    document.addEventListener('firebase-initialized', function() {
      clearTimeout(initializationTimeout);
      console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Firebase initialized event received');
    });
  };
  
  // Fix network connectivity issues
  const fixNetworkConnectivity = function() {
    // Monitor for network errors related to Firebase domains
    window.addEventListener('error', function(event) {
      if (event && event.target && event.target.src) {
        const src = event.target.src;
        if (src.includes('googleapis.com') || src.includes('gstatic.com')) {
          console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Detected network error for Firebase resource:', src);
          
          // Retry loading the resource with a cache-busting parameter
          if (!src.includes('nocache')) {
            const cacheBustSrc = src + (src.includes('?') ? '&' : '?') + 'nocache=' + Date.now();
            console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Retrying with cache-busting:', cacheBustSrc);
            
            // Create a new script element
            const newScript = document.createElement('script');
            newScript.src = cacheBustSrc;
            document.head.appendChild(newScript);
          }
        }
      }
    }, true);
  };
  
  // Apply all fixes
  const applyAllFixes = function() {
    if (isGoDaddy()) {
      console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Running on GoDaddy hosting, applying all fixes');
      applyCSPFixes();
      fixFirebaseInitialization();
      fixNetworkConnectivity();
    } else {
      console.log('[Firebase GoDaddy Compatibility] Not running on GoDaddy hosting, no fixes applied');
    }
  };
  
  // Run when the DOM is ready
  if (document.readyState === 'loading') {
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', applyAllFixes);
  } else {
    applyAllFixes();
  }
})();
</content>

<content># GoDaddy Deployment Guide for AI Sports Edge

This guide provides instructions for deploying the AI Sports Edge web application to GoDaddy shared hosting, with specific focus on ensuring Firebase functionality works correctly.

## What's Been Fixed

We've implemented several fixes to address the issues with Firebase on GoDaddy hosting:

1. **Content Security Policy (CSP) Updates**:
   - Updated the CSP in both the HTML meta tag and .htaccess file to include all required Firebase domains
   - Added explicit permissions for Firebase authentication, storage, and other services

2. **Script Loading Improvements**:
   - Implemented a robust script loading mechanism that ensures Firebase configuration is loaded before initialization
   - Added fallback mechanisms to handle loading failures

3. **Firebase Initialization Enhancements**:
   - Created a more resilient Firebase initialization process with multiple fallback options
   - Added explicit error handling and recovery mechanisms

4. **GoDaddy Compatibility Layer**:
   - Added a dedicated compatibility script (`firebase-godaddy-compatibility.js`) that addresses GoDaddy-specific issues
   - Implemented dynamic CSP adjustments and network connectivity fixes

## Deployment Instructions

Follow these steps to deploy the application to GoDaddy:

### 1. Prepare Your Files

Ensure you have all the required files ready for deployment:

- All HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files in the `dist` directory
- The updated `.htaccess` file with the correct CSP settings
- All Firebase configuration files

### 2. Upload Files to GoDaddy

1. Log in to your GoDaddy account and access your cPanel or File Manager
2. Navigate to your website's root directory (usually `public_html` or `www`)
3. Upload all files from the `dist` directory to this location
4. Make sure to preserve the directory structure and file permissions

**Important**: Ensure the `.htaccess` file is properly uploaded. This file is often hidden, so you may need to enable "Show Hidden Files" in your file manager.

### 3. Verify File Permissions

Set the correct file permissions:

- HTML, CSS, JS files: `644` (read and write for owner, read for group and others)
- Directories: `755` (read, write, execute for owner, read and execute for group and others)
- `.htaccess` file: `644`

### 4. Test the Deployment

1. Navigate to your website URL in a browser
2. Check the browser console for any errors related to Firebase
3. If you see Firebase initialization errors, access the diagnostic page:
   ```
   https://yourdomain.com/firebase-advanced-diagnostics.html
   ```
4. Run the tests on the diagnostic page to identify any remaining issues

### 5. Troubleshooting Common Issues

If you encounter issues after deployment:

#### CSP Errors

If you see CSP-related errors in the console:

1. Verify that the `.htaccess` file was uploaded correctly
2. Check if GoDaddy's server is overriding your CSP settings
3. Contact GoDaddy support to ensure mod_headers is enabled on your hosting plan

#### Firebase Connection Issues

If Firebase fails to connect:

1. Check if your GoDaddy hosting plan allows outbound connections to Firebase domains
2. Try using the minimal Firebase configuration by editing `firebase-config.js` to include only essential fields
3. Consider upgrading to a higher-tier GoDaddy hosting plan with fewer restrictions

#### Script Loading Errors

If scripts fail to load:

1. Clear your browser cache and try again
2. Verify that all script files were uploaded correctly
3. Check for any JavaScript errors in the browser console that might be preventing execution

## Advanced Configuration

### Custom Domain Setup

If you're using a custom domain with Firebase Authentication:

1. Add your domain to the authorized domains list in the Firebase Console:
   - Go to Authentication > Sign-in method > Authorized domains
   - Add your GoDaddy domain (e.g., `yourdomain.com`)

### Environment Variables

If you need to change Firebase configuration values:

1. Edit the `firebase-config.js` file directly on the server
2. Make sure to keep the same structure and variable names

## Security Considerations

While the implemented solution prioritizes compatibility with GoDaddy hosting, be aware of these security considerations:

1. The CSP has been made more permissive to ensure Firebase works correctly
2. Firebase configuration is stored in client-side JavaScript
3. Error messages may reveal more information than ideal in a production environment

To mitigate these concerns:

1. Implement strong Firebase Security Rules to restrict access to your data
2. Consider using Firebase App Check for additional security
3. Remove the diagnostic tools (`firebase-advanced-diagnostics.html` and `firebase-diagnostics.js`) after successful deployment

## Support and Maintenance

If you encounter issues with this deployment:

1. Check the browser console for specific error messages
2. Use the diagnostic tool to identify the exact problem
3. Refer to the Firebase documentation for the latest recommendations
4. Consider consulting with a Firebase specialist if problems persist
